title: Why do I feel like music nowadays is just tasteless, while older music was heavenly? - Quora

response.answer_text: There is no simple answer to this dilemma. It is the mentality of most of the adults now that songs of bygone era stuck with us longer. But this is mainly due to the fact that those songs have been introduced to us since our most impressionable age. We grow up listening to a particular art and then we start to gravitate towards that art form more. For example, try to remember the last good song that you heard. You will find that it is not that distant in the future. Another factor that influences this argument is the type of music you like. If you like serious sombre tones, then the present music of bollywood wouldn’t satisfy you. But you can look towards the indie scene of India, which features some great artists. Rock and Fusion fans look towards the live performance of local bands more than the movie music. Some great and beautiful songs of past 25 years have come from indie artists in India. Hariharan, KK, Shaan have also started from there. Also, to realize the true leaps being made in terms of music, you need only watch Coke Studio. It has brilliant artists doing things they wouldn’t do in a live show. Lastly, the old songs were outstanding because more emphasis was given to singers and vocals. This era has devoted their effort towards music and instruments, so much so that singers have become secondary in a song. Music lovers appreciate good music, but it doesn’t always have to be the taste of the masses. For instance, The Humma Song by A. R. Rehman was derided as he took his own classic track changed it completely. What everyone ignored was the outstanding changes Rehman made to the music and base-line of the track. The lack of the rock-and-roll hook stuck as boring to most people. But Rehman brought Dubstep and Fusion into mainstream bollywood and as a result, now people are loving that song. It is only a matter of what piques your interest. If you don’t like the mainstream music of today, then don’t listen to it. Explore other genres of music that are niche but so good that you will rarely ever complain again.
